byline.contributor: Kristin Hussey reported from Middletown, and Tatiana Schlossberg from New York.
byline.original: By KRISTIN HUSSEY and TATIANA SCHLOSSBERG

abstract: Ten Wesleyan University students and two others are hospitalized for possible overdoses on Molly, party drug described as pure form of MDMA or Ecstasy that has lately gained popularity.
lead_paragraph: The police said it was likely that the overdoses were a result of a “bad batch” of Molly, a party drug similar to MDMA or Ecstasy that has recently gained popularity.

headline.main: 12 at Wesleyan University Are Hospitalized for Drug Overdoses
headline.print_headline: 12 Overdose on a Drug at Wesleyan University

snippet: The police said it was likely that the overdoses were a result of a “bad batch” of Molly, a party drug similar to MDMA or Ecstasy that has recently gained popularity.
